text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for
review of the new fallujah album the
flesh prevails before I get into this
review I want to say thank you to these
cute little babies for the shout out in
a recent video that they were in I will
link to that video down in the
description box and fallujah is a
california metal band this is their
second album their sophomore album a lot
of metal fans passing this record my way
telling me to check it out
really urgent in their recommendation of
this album and these guys are a death
metal band a technical death metal band
to be specific genre I don't really mind
or even enjoy at its roots or with some
of its bigger names like Niall death
cynic gore guts atheist I also enjoy a
little bit of ulcerate bands like this
technical and melodic death metal bands
find ways to make death metal a little
more dynamic and incorporate some really
complex compositions and guitar work and
melodies into the tremolo Pickett ARS
and the beats and the guttural growling
that we typically hear in death metal
and Fallujah is not only pretty flashy
and they are incredibly melodic but they
try to work in a bit of atmosphere into
their songs as well there are loads of
epic soaring guitar solos on top of
these chugging riffs and intense drums
and these guitar solos are soaked in
this really larger-than-life reverb that
feels kind of interstellar there's just
relentless drumming throughout this
record - the rhythms the grooves they're
all pretty dizzying and for the most
part I think the band does a good job of
balancing simplicity and complexity on
this album - even though the
performances may seem really difficult
it's not that hard to grasp what the
band is doing on a first listen they
might have a slow moving chord
progression but then they'll throw some
insane drumming behind it or they'll
have a really difficult groove the riff
is bringing forward but they'll pair
that with one of those sweet huge
melodic guitar solos Felucia has a lot
of good things going
for them but I still don't like this
album it's it's just a shame and it
really for the most part comes down to
production I don't like how this record
is mixed recorded compressed to death
the way this record sounds to me is
absolutely excruciating after long
periods of time and not in a way where
it's like whoa this band's really brutal
I feel like sonically there that they're
really pushing the envelope it's not
because the band feels incredibly loud
but again feels incredibly compressed
all the sound all the instrumentation
just brick walled and smushed down until
you're just getting this bodyless
chaotic wall of guitars and drums that
are just continually smothering one
another in this really ugly display
frequency clashing not only does the
reverb on this LP sound just grossly
synthetic but the drums have the tambour
of smacking the driver side door of a
car with a piece of PVC pipe the vocal
delivery and the guitar tone as well are
kind of dime-a-dozen as far as this
current state of melodic and technical
death metal goes even though it seems
like Fallujah puts a lot of effort into
the composition of this record really
making sure that every note every drum
beat every vocal is in its place and
perform to perfection as far as the
mixing on this record it's frustratingly
tangled there are some more ethereal
tracks on this record that do serve as
kind of a counterpoint and a bit of a
break a bit of a breather from the more
intense and dense tracks on this LP but
all the other songs just kind of blend
together for me in a really unappealing
way I can most definitely appreciate
flawless punchy clean metal production
records like carcasses heart work will
forever be a metal favorite of mine and
metal classic and sort of a pioneer in
the current trend of ultra clean digital
metal production that we see today but
bands like Fallujah push this trend so
far I don't even feel like I'm listening
to humans perform on a record anymore to
me this record is like the equivalent
adding sex with a robot the most
expressive thing to me on this record
are the melodies and
melodically it's not like this band
brings anything forward that a group
such as Animals As Leaders doesn't
already and to me melody alone does not
make a good song if all of your
foundational instrumentation on a track
sounds like soulless droids are
performing it then the melody doesn't
really make a difference I know in
modern metal this kind of record
qualifies as a very brutal sound but to
me brutality is very human
characteristic it's an animalistic
characteristic if you strip your music
of its animality of its and you just
make it as robotic and as sequenced and
as perfect as possible the brutality
doesn't really seep through instead for
me this record reads as cold emotionless
ruckus with some nice melody splashed on
top I'm feeling a strong for tool like
five on this thing transition if you've
given this LP listen what did you think
of it did you love it did you hate it
why what do you think I should review
next and that's it Anthony Fantana
Felucia forever
